derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English rūn 'a secret, mystery'; not recorded between Middle English and the late 17th cent., when it was reintroduced under the influence of Old Norse rúnir, rúnar 'magic signs, hidden lore'

encyclopedia.content: rune就是如尼文，如尼文是一套字母表，开始它属于大约1500年前的北欧和日尔曼人。这一“字母表”中的“字母”被认为包含着可以进行占卜的神秘因素。“如尼”（Rune）—词意思是“神秘的”或“隐蔽的”。

entry.tran: 如尼字母，如尼文（古代北欧人使用的一种刻在石头或木头上并被认为有神奇力量的文字）
entry.def: Runes are letters from an alphabet that was used by people in Northern Europe in former times. They were carved on wood or stone and were believed to have magical powers.

means.word_mean: 1. any character from an ancient Germanic alphabet used in Scandinavia from the 3rd century to the Middle Ages;

sentences.sentence: "each rune had its own magical significance"
